info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 7:45PM CDT until April 13 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT FOR SIMPSON AND EASTERN COPIAH COUNTIES... At 745 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hopewell, or 10 miles southeast of Crystal Springs, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Union and Harrisville around 755 PM CDT. Pinola around 800 PM CDT. Mendenhall around 805 PM CDT. Magee, Martinville and Sanatorium around 815 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include D`Lo, Beauregard, Braxton and Georgetown. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central, south central and southeastern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
